reason: The 'verboseLog' configuration in the 'dconverter' software project is performance-sensitive because enabling verbose logging typically results in a significant increase in the amount of data being processed and stored. This can lead to increased execution time due to the overhead of logging operations, as well as increased memory consumption to handle the larger log data. Additionally, if the logging is performed synchronously, it can block the main execution thread, further impacting performance. Therefore, changes to this configuration can notably affect system performance.
